<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 186, 171, 201]]<|/det|>
# PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 207, 279, 222]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[90, 247, 590, 291]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Multiple Choice Answer Sheet Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB recommended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[90, 312, 388, 329]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 343, 235, 358]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 358, 599, 373]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 373, 892, 403]]<|/det|>
Write your name, Centre number and candidate number on the Answer Sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 415, 892, 446]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions. For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 445, 890, 462]]<|/det|>
Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the separate Answer Sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 473, 556, 491]]<|/det|>
Read the instructions on the Answer Sheet very carefully.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 503, 764, 535]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer. Any rough working should be done in this booklet.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

She plans to measure the <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 87, 532, 106]]<|/det|> making a sound and hearing the echo from a cliff. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[170, 106, 824, 282]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 303, 490, 325]]<|/det|> She will use the equation: speed = \(\frac{\text{distance}}{\text{time}}.\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 345, 880, 364]]<|/det|> Which type of sound should she make and which distance should she use in her calculation? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 374, 645, 522]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 72, 808, 92]]<|/det|>

cm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 106, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>13</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 688, 92]]<|/det|>
A water manometer is used to measure the pressure of a gas supply.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[270, 98, 715, 323]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 332, 920, 368]]<|/det|>
When it is attached to the gas supply, the water falls on the left side and rises on the right side. The difference in the levels of water on the two sides is now \(20 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 378, 445, 397]]<|/det|>
What is the pressure of the gas supply?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 407, 134, 425]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 407, 490, 425]]<|/det|>
the pressure due to \(10 \text{cm}\) depth of water

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 435, 134, 453]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 435, 490, 453]]<|/det|>
the pressure due to \(20 \text{cm}\) depth of water

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 462, 134, 479]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 460, 714, 479]]<|/det|>
the pressure due to \(10 \text{cm}\) depth of water plus atmospheric pressure

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 488, 133, 505]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 486, 714, 505]]<|/det|>
the pressure due to \(20 \text{cm}\) depth of water plus atmospheric pressure

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 530, 106, 549]]<|/det|>
<label>14</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 529, 920, 564]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows an electric heater being used to heat a beaker of water and an identical beaker of oil for several minutes.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[322, 570, 675, 700]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 714, 920, 749]]<|/det|>
The temperature of the water and the temperature of the oil increase constantly. The rise in temperature of the oil is much greater than that of the water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 761, 220, 778]]<|/det|>
Why is this?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 789, 131, 806]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 789, 520, 807]]<|/det|>
The oil has a higher boiling point than water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 816, 131, 833]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 816, 554, 833]]<|/det|>
The oil has a higher thermal capacity than water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 842, 131, 860]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 842, 510, 860]]<|/det|>
The oil has a lower boiling point than water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 868, 133, 887]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 868, 547, 887]]<|/det|>
The oil has a lower thermal capacity than water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 107, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>15</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 72, 808, 107]]<|/det|>
Evaporation occurs when molecules escape from a liquid surface into the air above process the temperature of the liquid falls.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 116, 477, 135]]<|/det|>
Why does the temperature of the liquid fall?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 145, 134, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 144, 697, 163]]<|/det|>
The molecules in the vapour expand because the pressure is less.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 171, 134, 190]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 170, 688, 190]]<|/det|>
The molecules left in the liquid have more space to move around.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 198, 134, 216]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 197, 680, 216]]<|/det|>
The molecules move more slowly when they escape into the air.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 223, 134, 242]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 222, 648, 241]]<|/det|>
The molecules with the highest energies escape into the air.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 269, 106, 287]]<|/det|>
<label>16</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 268, 920, 303]]<|/det|>
To mark the lower fixed point of a Celsius scale on a thermometer, the thermometer should be placed in

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 312, 133, 330]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 312, 260, 330]]<|/det|>
pure alcohol.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 339, 133, 357]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 339, 314, 356]]<|/det|>
pure distilled water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 365, 133, 384]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 364, 292, 382]]<|/det|>
pure melting ice.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 390, 133, 408]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 390, 270, 408]]<|/det|>
pure mercury.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 104, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>17</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 561, 92]]<|/det|>
Two identical copper cans are filled with boiling water.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[278, 95, 715, 312]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 327, 920, 361]]<|/det|>
One can is insulated with wool. The temperature of the water in each can is taken every minute for several minutes. Graphs of the results are plotted.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 371, 460, 390]]<|/det|>
Which graph shows the results obtained?

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 396, 922, 722]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>18</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 72, 819, 107]]<|/det|>
The pressure of a fixed mass of gas in a cylinder is measured. The volume of the cylinder is then slowly decreased. The temperature of the gas does not change.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 116, 776, 135]]<|/det|>
Which graph could show the change of pressure of the gas during this process?

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 144, 875, 545]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 570, 106, 588]]<|/det|>
<label>19</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 570, 532, 588]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a cooling unit in a refrigerator.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[358, 597, 640, 785]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 797, 458, 816]]<|/det|>
Why is the cooling unit placed at the top?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 826, 134, 844]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 826, 551, 845]]<|/det|>
Cold air falls and warm air is displaced upwards.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 853, 133, 871]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 853, 747, 871]]<|/det|>
Cold air is a bad conductor so heat is not conducted into the refrigerator.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 880, 131, 898]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 880, 745, 898]]<|/det|>
Cold air is a good conductor so heat is conducted out of the refrigerator.
